Package view

Class NavCalendarView

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.NavCalendarView
  • public class NavCalendarView
extends java.lang.Object
    Navigation calendar with month view.Using the gregorian calendar we put the days of the current month as buttons and you can call previous week and next week.The final view will be a 7x6 GridPane containing all the days of the month as well as some days behind and after the month with the option to navigate through this day's.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      NavCalendarView​(Model model, CalendarViewController calendarViewController)
      Constructor of NavCalendarView.The view is generated inside the constructor, and then you can get the final view to display it dynamically.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.Calendar getCalendar()
      This method returns the gregorian calendar(the brain of the view) from the class
      java.lang.String getCurrentMonth()
      This method creates an array with all the months and then assigns the current month to a string
      javafx.scene.layout.VBox getFinalView()
      Get the final view of the calendar to display it dynamically
      void initDays()
      This method initializes the text and the functionality of the buttons inside.
      void navNextWeek()
      This method adds one month to the calendar and update the days as well as the header
      void navPrevWeek()
      This method subtracts one month to the calendar and update the days as well as the header
      void updateMonthHeader()
      This method sets the text of the header , so it can be accurate.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • NavCalendarView

        public NavCalendarView​(Model model,
                       CalendarViewController calendarViewController)
        Constructor of NavCalendarView.The view is generated inside the constructor, and then you can get the final view to display it dynamically.
        Parameters:
        model - information from the model
        calendarViewController - the controller is needed to link necessary methods to day buttons

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentMonth

        public java.lang.String getCurrentMonth()
        This method creates an array with all the months and then assigns the current month to a string
        Returns:
        a string representing the current month taken from the gregorian calendar

      • updateMonthHeader

        public void updateMonthHeader()
        This method sets the text of the header , so it can be accurate.

      • getFinalView

        public javafx.scene.layout.VBox getFinalView()
        Get the final view of the calendar to display it dynamically
        Returns:
        Vbox (header and day buttons) representing the final view

      • initDays

        public void initDays()
        This method initializes the text and the functionality of the buttons inside. Using the gregorian calendar inside of this class we first find the position of the first day in the month.After that this method sets all the days behind the first day.Then we set the days that are actually in the month and the functionality of them.

      • navNextWeek

        public void navNextWeek()
        This method adds one month to the calendar and update the days as well as the header

      • navPrevWeek

        public void navPrevWeek()
        This method subtracts one month to the calendar and update the days as well as the header

      • getCalendar

        public java.util.Calendar getCalendar()
        This method returns the gregorian calendar(the brain of the view) from the class
        Returns:
        the gregorian calendar
